page.title: 03Changing Crockenhill part 1
page.content: Crockenhill like many villages close to London has changed greatly over the last 60 years.The main changes have been in the physical development and the social make-up.In the 1920's Crockenhill was a small rural community where the majority of people worked on the land .The farmers grew mainly fruit and vegetables for sale in the markets of London.The workers lived in small terraced houses with as many as 12 people in one house.The standard of living was low and it was not uncommon for families to be at starvation level and for children to be dressed in rags and be barefoot.Most of the farming was done manually and the wages before WW2 were about Â£1.60 per week.The poorest people were generally seasonal workers from London who lived in small corrugated iron sheds and suffered
